ieee.position-1-subtitle: IEEE SB CET Special Interest Group for AI · Since February 2020
ieee.position-1-description:
• Set up an industry collaboration with Neuroplex to provide experienced training and internship opportunities.
  • Hosted workshop series on Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Friendly AI - 23 participants went on to complete projects in predictive analysis.
  • Hosted webinar series on Data Science and Deep Learning.
  • Organized AI Safety competiton, which closed with an analysis of the common fallacies faced (Check that link out, I swear it's cooler than it sounds).
  • Collaborated with the Machine Intelligence Research Institute for instructional material and technical assistance.
  • Founded 2 Special Interest Groups for AI in IEEE Student Branches across the state.

airli.position-2-description: Developing a machine learning model to process satellite imagery to generate actionable insights relating to pollen forecasts, for clients working to improve quality-of-life apropos of asthma and air quality.

freelance.position-3-description: I do front-end design and development.

mulearn.position-4-description:
• Oversaw heuristics of instructional methods and handling of source material.
  • Managing and formatting the MuLearn website.

evoke.award-1-description:
National level tech summit by IEDC TKMCE and IEEE SB TKMCE.
Developed an emergency management platform (Refer Karma in the preceding section).

reboot.award-2-description:
Healthcare Category, State level Hackathon series by the State Department for Higher Education.
Developed a mental health triage and support framework (Refer Mentem in the preceding section).

pass-the-code.award-3-description: State-level tag-team coding competition conducted by the SBs of IEEE, IEDC, and ISTE of Barton Hill College of Engineering.

akcssc.award-4-description:
State-level web design competition conducted by IEEE CSKS as part of AKCSSC 2020.
Submitted the NextJS-built web front-end of Veris (refer in the preceding section).

oratrium.award-5-description: State level public speaking competition by JCI, judged and awarded by Dr. Shashi Tharoor.

cet.education-1-description: When I'm not cutting classes to do something else, I'm a third year Computer Science undergraduate.

loyola.education-2-description: There's much more to say than could fit in this space to do justice.

the-calibration-game.work-1-description:
An android app that optimizes credence calibration - the accuracy of belief strengths against real success rates - with a scoring system that incentivizes alignment of "sureness" with success rates.

A better description can be found here.

metise.work-2-description:
A conditional generative adversarial network for fixed image (de-)compression. Compression is performed along the dimensions of colour density, being a relatively intractable direction outside neural net reconstruction.

I'm currently writing a paper on this, but the code is available below.

mentem.work-3-description: Mentem was originally envisioned as an all in one platform for mental health support using virtual, professional, and community resources, triage using speech and facial analysis, and health clinic assistance.  It is currently being developed into an all in one platform - a hospital ERP system.

karma.work-4-description: An emergency management framework that incentivizes small-scale demand-specific rescue operations.  Emergency alerts are sent out on a tiered structure using P2P networks, ordered by severity.  Damage extent maps are plotted using alert data.

veris.work-5-description:
An open-source educational administration framework I helped build. This is being developed to replace outmoded methods of handling data and process in higher educational institutes, while providing the flexibility to fit specific use-cases.

Currently in alpha testing in CET.

phemos.work-6-description:
A news algorithm I developed to account for a documented positive feedback relationship between media coverage and electoral polling. The algorithm weighs down overexposure on a log scale.

More on the aforementioned effect here.

about-description:
Hello there. I'm Arun Jose.

I develop, research, write, and draw. I like making things, and I make whatever I think would be good, regardless of domain. I sometimes go by the mononym Jozdien. â€‹I think AI Alignment is the most important problem of our time, and that's what I want to spend my time working on.

I enjoy all genres of fiction when done well, but my favourites are rational fiction and meta/absurd comedy (as well as crack fanfiction, which feels appropriate closed off in brackets).

Instagram and Email are my most frequented platforms for messages, so if you have ideas, want to collaborate, or just think I'd find something interesting (I probably will - err on the side of messaging me), just send me a message with the phrase "Duncain wants you".
